titleStmt.title: F. B. McClary et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1811

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency, Thomas E Bramlette,

Your Petitioners would most respectfully represent unto your Excellency, that a vacancy has accured in the office of the Justice of the Peace in the 4th District in Rockcastle County by the resignation of Marshall R Mullins. We recommend to you favorable consideration our esteemed friend and county man Richard R Hackney, as a suitable and proper person to fill said vacancy and think it would give general satisfaction by the appointment of said Hackney as he is worthy and well qualified.

March 10th 1864
